RESOLVED_ENTITIES.this Court: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the federal district court is located and whose Constitution protects residents from unreasonable searches
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: federal court that reviews cases related to border patrol stops and provides guidance to jurors on their duties and responsibilities, also responsible for giving instructions to the jury
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States district court: federal court that made the original judgment in the case, allowed the defendant to present evidence pertinent to the suppression motion, and made oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of the stop and search
